title: Hurricane Melissa hits Jamaica as category 5 storm | ABC NEWS
description: Hurricane Melissa has made landfall in Jamaica as a category 5 system, packing destructive winds and powerful storm surges.  At least three people have been killed in the largest hurricane to hit Jamaica since records began 170 years ago.  The storm is projected to barrel towards Cuba and the Bahamas afterwards.  Jamaica Gleaner reporter Karen Madden, who has covered many storms to hit the Caribbean in her 20-year career, says the scale and strength of the storm are ‘new’ to her,  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE Read more here: https://www.abc.net.au/news/2025-10-29/storm-melissa-jamaica-live/105945328  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: A look inside the devastation in Gaza | ABC NEWS
description: ABC’s Middle East correspondent Matthew Doran has travelled inside the “yellow line” an area in Gaza still under Israeli control. International media has not been able to independently access Gaza since the start of war with all visits still under the strict supervision and control of the Israeli military. title: Fawlty Towers star Prunella Scales dies aged 93 | ABC NEWS
description: British actor Prunella Scales, best known for playing Sybil Fawlty in Fawlty Towers has died age 93. She performed on stage and screen for almost 70 years and her family says she was watching an episode of Fawlty Towers the day before she died. title: Spirit of Tasmania operator doubled down before $9m blunder | ABC NEWS
description: In 2023, Spirit of Tasmania operator TT-Line made changes to the specifications for fenders at the wharf in Devonport to accommodate the two new vessels.  TasPorts questioned the changes, but were refused access to the shipbuilder to clarify concerns, and the incorrect designs went ahead — resulting in $9 million in works to rectify problems. title: Eight Queensland schools teach students about wrong Ceasar for year 12 exam | ABC NEWS
description: At least eight Queensland high schools have apologised for mixing up the ancient history curriculum and teaching their students about the wrong Ceasar for a year 12 exam.  The prestigious Brisbane State High School warned students they had been taught about Augustus Ceasar rather than Julius Ceasar just days before the test.  The assessment authority said students could be given special consideration, while Queensland Education Minister John-Paul Langbroek launched an investigation into the blunder. title: Albanese wraps up ASEAN visit, heads to South Korea for APEC | ABC NEWS
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has concluded his visit to Malaysia for the ASEAN summit. The Australian leader met and held a joint press conference with Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim to discuss escalating tensions and risks of confrontation in the South China Sea, after Chinese fighter jets released flares near an Australian surveillance plane. Mr Albanese is heading to South Korea for the APEC summit, where US  President Donald Trump and Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping are expected to meet on the sidelines to hash out a trade deal. description: Hurricane Melissa has crossed the Jamaican coast as a dangerous category five system, making it the Caribbean nation's strongest-ever storm. title: Female Aboriginal prisoner dies in custody in Tasmania | ABC NEWS
description: An Aboriginal woman remanded in custody in Hobart died after a "serious medical episode", the Tasmania Prison Service says.  The Tasmanian Aboriginal Legal Service believes it is the first Aboriginal death in custody in Tasmania since the 1990s as Madeleine Rojahn reports. title: Teachers, other public workers begin strikes in Tasmania | ABC NEWS
description: Teachers, health workers, firefighters and other public sector employees have rallied in Tasmania's north-west as they call for better pay and conditions. title: City of Sydney limits busking in the CBD | ABC NEWS
description: The City of Sydney is introducing laws to limit buskers from performing in the CBD. Under the changes, no busking is permitted on George Street between Circular Quay and Haymarket except for six spots, limited to an hour per busker per day on a first-in basis.
